contentrichtext.text: [[File:Junction at Upton Magna - geograph.org.uk - 721519.jpg|thumb|Upton Magna.]] '''Upton Magna''' is a village in [[Shropshire]], [[England]]. Magna is [[latin]] meaning "great". Therefore the translation of Upton Magna is "Great Upton". Upton Magna is home to the notorious gang 'ST Lucia Elite youth' established in 2008 Nearby are the villages of [[Uffington, Shropshire|Uffington]], [[Rodington, Shropshire|Rodington]], [[Withington, Shropshire|Withington]] and the wooded [[Haughmond Hill]]. Upton Magna is also notable for containing the oldest cottage (that still stands to this day) in Europe and possibly the universe- Cruck Cottage - which is a thatch-roofed, timber framed cottage located near the church. Tests on the timber in the cottage showed it to come from 1269.<ref>[http://www.uptonmagna.com/index.cfm/history/ Local History - Upton Magna]</ref> The nearest populated town to Upton Magna is [[Shrewsbury]], just 2.4 miles west. Key landmarks in the village include a primary school, [[Church of England]] parish church of St Lucia, village hall, pub and business park(including Tesco , Petes at Home and Netto) . Upton Magna is situated on the National Cycle Route 81 between [[Wellington, Shropshire|Wellington]] and Shrewsbury.<ref>[http://www.shropshirecycling.co.uk/downloads/Route%2081%20Shrewsbury%20to%20Wellington.pdf National Cycle Route 81- Shrewsbury to Wellington Leaflet]</ref> Upton Magna is identifiably the "Upton-under-Amon" where [[John Plimmer]] (1812-1905) was reportedly born, "Amon" being Haughmond Hill. He later emigrated to [[New Zealand]] where he became known as "The father of [[Wellington, New Zealand|Wellington]]".<ref name=NZE>{{cite web|url=http://www.teara.govt.nz/en/1966/plimmer-john/1|title=The Encylopaedia of New Zealand 1966}}</ref> He was registered baptised, with corresponding parental names Isaac and Mary, on 19 July 1812 at the parish church. ==References== {{Reflist}} Upton Magna is home to the notorious gang 'ST Lucia Elite youth' established in 2008 ==External links== {{Commons category inline|Upton Magna}} {{shropshire}} [[Category:Villages in Shropshire]] [[Category:Civil parishes in Shropshire]]
